reporting-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD)

title.narrative: Chad - Integrated Humanitarian Response in Lac Province - Oxfam-Québec 2021
Tchad - Réponse humanitaire intégrée dans la province du Lac - Oxfam-Québec 2021

description.narrative: March 2021 — Chad is facing interconnected humanitarian crises in a context of chronic poverty and limited development. The security situation in neighbouring countries is still contributing to the sporadic movement of people to Chad, particularly to the southern part of the country for people coming from the Central African Republic, to the eastern part of the country for people coming from Sudan, and internal displacements in Lac province in the western part of the country. In this context, it is estimated that close to 5.5 million people will need emergency humanitarian assistance. Moreover, malnutrition continues to grow as a result of the harmful effects of the COVID 19 pandemic, which is contributing to a worsening of the malnutrition situation and is leading to health problems. With GAC’s support, Oxfam-Québec is meeting the urgent needs of approximately 39,000 people who are affected by conflict in Lac province. Project activities include: (1) building 4 sources of water and 100 family latrines, which will benefit 36,000 people; (2) building 4 additional care rooms, including 2 that are geared toward consultations for women; (3) distributing 800 sanitary and female dignity kits; (4) distributing 1,000 child care and hygiene kits to malnourished mother and child pairs; (5) implementing a referral system that will reach 65% of male and female survivors of gender based violence in order to guide them to appropriate services; and (6) organizing 10 education sessions on health rights, particularly relating to sexual and reproductive health.

Mars 2021 - Le Tchad fait face à des crises humanitaires interconnectées, dans un contexte de pauvreté chronique et de faible développement. La situation sécuritaire dans les pays voisins continue d’engendrer des mouvements sporadiques de personnes vers le Tchad, en particulier au sud en provenance de la République Centrafricaine, à l’est en provenance du Soudan, ainsi que des déplacements internes dans la province du Lac à l’ouest. Dans ce contexte, il est estimé que près de 5,5 millions de personnes doivent avoir besoin d’une assistance humanitaire d’urgence. De plus, la malnutrition accrue continue d’augmenter avec les effets néfastes de la pandémie COVID-19 contribue à la détérioration de la malnutrition accrue et de la santé. Avec l’aide d’AMC, Oxfam-Québec répond aux besoins urgents d’environ 39 000 personnes affectées par le conflit dans la province du Lac. Les activités du projet comprennent : 1) construire 4 points d’eau et 100 latrines familiales, visant à bénéficier à 36 000 personnes; 2) construire 4 salles de soins supplémentaires dont deux sont destinées aux consultations féminines; 3) distribuer 800 kits d’hygiène et de dignité féminine; 4) distribuer 1000 trousses de soins infantiles et d’hygiènes aux couples mère-enfant malnutris; 5) mettre en place un système de référencement bénéficiant à 65% des survivantes et survivants des cas de violence basée sur le genre afin de les orienter vers les services compétents; 6) organiser 10 séances de vulgarisation des droits en matière de santé particulièrement en santé sexuelle et reproductive.

participating-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada

Canada
Oxfam-Québec
Oxfam-Québec

organisation.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD)

description.narrative: Les résultats escomptés de ce projet comprennent : 1) l’accès accru et sécurisé à l'eau potable et aux installations sanitaires; 2) la capacité accrue des centres de santé à fournir des soins primaires dignes et adaptés aux besoins des populations vulnérables; 3) l’appropriation accrue de pratiques d'hygiène efficaces et adéquates; 4) l’accès renforcé à la prévention et à la prise en charge de la malnutrition, en particulier chez les enfants souffrant de malnutrition aiguë; 5) l’accès facilité aux services de protection; 6) la connaissance renforcée des femmes et filles des populations déplacées et leurs hôtes de leurs droits en matière de santé, notamment la santé sexuelle et reproductive. Le résultat final escompté est de sauver des vies, d’atténuer les souffrances et de préserver la dignité humaine dans les pays en proie à des crises humanitaires ou à une insécurité alimentaire aiguë.

The expected outcomes for this project include: (1) increased and safe access to drinking water and sanitation facilities; (2) increased ability of health centres to provide meaningful primary care that is adapted to the needs of vulnerable communities; (3) increased use of effective and appropriate hygiene practices; (4) enhanced access to prevention and treatment of malnutrition, particularly in children suffering from acute malnutrition; (5) easier access to protection services; and (6) greater knowledge among women and girls from displaced populations and their hosts about their health rights, particularly regarding sexual and reproductive health. The expected ultimate outcome is lives saved, suffering alleviated and human dignity maintained in countries experiencing humanitarian crises or acute food insecurity.

reporting-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)

title.narrative: Assistance humanitaire aux déplacés internes en Éthiopie - CARE 2021
Humanitarian Assistance for Internally Displaced People in Ethiopia - CARE 2021

description.narrative: February 2021 - Prior to the outbreak of conflict in the Tigray region in late 2020, Ethiopia was already facing ongoing acute humanitarian need, arising from sporadic but widespread intercommunal conflict, regional drought and flooding, swarms of desert locusts, the economic pressure of the COVID-19 pandemic, and the impact of hosting nearly 800,000 refugees throughout the country. Together, these crises have led to widespread food insecurity, high levels of acute malnutrition, and significant population displacement. Although ongoing fighting and other access restrictions have hindered full needs assessments in Tigray, an estimated 29 million people in Ethiopia are likely to require humanitarian assistance in 2021. With GAC’s support, CARE is preventing and treating acute malnutrition, improving access to safe water and sanitation, and helping households to meet essential needs amongst internally displaced persons and host communities in Ethiopia’s drought- and conflict-affected Somali region. Project activities include: (1) identifying and treating acute malnutrition; (2) rehabilitating water points and distributing sanitation and hygiene related non-food items; and, (3) providing unconditional cash grants to crisis-affected households.

Février 2021 – À la fin de 2020, lorsqu’un conflit a éclaté dans la région du Tigré, l’Éthiopie était déjà confrontée à des besoins humanitaires aigus et persistants, en raison de conflits intercommunautaires sporadiques, mais généralisés, de la sécheresse et des inondations régionales, des essaims de criquets pèlerins, de la pression économique liée à la pandémie de COVID 19 et de l’accueil de près de 800 000 réfugiés dans tout le pays. Toutes ces crises ont entraîné une insécurité alimentaire généralisée, des niveaux élevés de malnutrition aiguë et des déplacements de population importants. Même si les affrontements actuels et les autres restrictions à l’accès empêchent d’évaluer pleinement les besoins au Tigré, on estime qu’en 2021, 29 millions de personnes auront probablement besoin d’une aide humanitaire dans ce pays. Avec le soutien d’AMC, CARE prévient et traite la malnutrition aiguë, améliore l’accès à l’eau potable et aux installations sanitaires, et aide les ménages à répondre aux besoins essentiels parmi les personnes déplacées et les communautés d’accueil dans la région somalienne d’Éthiopie, touchée par la sécheresse et les conflits. Les activités de ce projet comprennent : 1) dépister et traiter la malnutrition aiguë; 2) réhabiliter les points d’eau et distribuer des articles non alimentaires liés à l’assainissement et à l’hygiène; 3) fournir des subventions sans conditions en espèces aux ménages touchés par la crise.

participating-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada
CARE Canada
CARE Canada
Canada
Canada

organisation.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD)

description.narrative: Les résultats escomptés de ce projet comprennent : 1) une réduction des taux de malnutrition aiguë; 2) une réduction de la propagation des maladies d’origine hydrique et de la COVID 19; 3) une amélioration de la capacité des ménages vulnérables à répondre à leurs besoins fondamentaux. Le résultat ultime escompté est de sauver des vies, d'atténuer les souffrances et de préserver la dignité humaine dans les pays qui connaissent des crises humanitaires ou une insécurité alimentaire aiguë.

The expected outcomes for this project include: (1) reduced rates of acute malnutrition; (2) reduced spread of water-borne disease and COVID-19; and, (3) improved ability of vulnerable households to meet basic needs. The expected ultimate outcome is lives saved, suffering alleviated, and human dignity maintained in countries experiencing humanitarian crises or acute food insecurity.

title.narrative: Nutrition Support for South Sudanese Refugees in Ethiopia - Concern 2021
Soutien nutritionnel aux réfugiés sud-soudanais en Éthiopie - Concern 2021

description.narrative: February 2021 - Prior to the outbreak of conflict in the Tigray region in late 2020, Ethiopia was already facing ongoing acute humanitarian need, arising from sporadic but widespread intercommunal conflict, regional drought and flooding, swarms of desert locusts, the economic pressure of the COVID-19 pandemic, and the impact of hosting nearly 800,000 refugees throughout the country. Together, these crises have led to widespread food insecurity, high levels of acute malnutrition, and significant population displacement. Although ongoing fighting and other access restrictions have hindered full needs assessments in Tigray, an estimated 29 million people in Ethiopia are likely to require humanitarian assistance in 2021. With GAC’s support, Concern is identifying and treating acute malnutrition amongst under-five children and pregnant and lactating women in the South Sudanese refugee population living in Ethiopia’s Gambella region. Project activities include: (1) conducting ongoing surveillance to identify acute malnutrition; (2) providing supplementary and therapeutic feeding to treat acute malnutrition; and, (3) providing training and support to improve dietary diversity amongst South Sudanese refugees in Gambella.

Février 2021 – À la fin de 2020, lorsqu’un conflit a éclaté dans la région du Tigré, l’Éthiopie était déjà confrontée à des besoins humanitaires aigus et persistants, en raison de conflits intercommunautaires sporadiques, mais généralisés, de la sécheresse et des inondations régionales, des essaims de criquets pèlerins, de la pression économique liée à la pandémie de COVID 19 et de l’accueil de près de 800 000 réfugiés dans tout le pays. Toutes ces crises ont entraîné une insécurité alimentaire généralisée, des niveaux élevés de malnutrition aiguë et des déplacements de population importants. Même si les affrontements actuels et les autres restrictions à l’accès empêchent d’évaluer pleinement les besoins au Tigré, on estime qu’en 2021, 29 millions de personnes auront probablement besoin d’une aide humanitaire dans ce pays. Avec le soutien d’AMC, Concern dépiste et traite la malnutrition aiguë chez les enfants de moins de cinq ans et les femmes enceintes et allaitantes de la population réfugiée du Soudan du Sud vivant dans la région de Gambella en Éthiopie. Les activités de ce projet comprennent : 1) mener une surveillance continue pour identifier la malnutrition aiguë; 2) fournir une alimentation complémentaire et thérapeutique pour traiter la malnutrition aiguë; 3) fournir une formation et un soutien pour améliorer la diversité alimentaire parmi les réfugiés du Soudan du Sud à Gambella.

Le résultat ultime escompté est de sauver des vies, d'atténuer les souffrances et de préserver la dignité humaine dans les pays qui connaissent des crises humanitaires ou une insécurité alimentaire aiguë.

The expected outcome for this project is reduced or maintained rates of acute malnutrition amongst vulnerable South Sudanese refugees in Gambella. The expected ultimate outcome is lives saved, suffering alleviated, and human dignity maintained in countries experiencing humanitarian crises or acute food insecurity.

title.narrative: Assistance humanitaire aux réfugiés sud-soudanais en Éthiopie - HelpAge 2021
Humanitarian Assistance for South Sudanese Refugees in Ethiopia - HelpAge 2021

description.narrative: February 2021 - Prior to the outbreak of conflict in the Tigray region in late 2020, Ethiopia was already facing ongoing acute humanitarian need, arising from sporadic but widespread intercommunal conflict, regional drought and flooding, swarms of desert locusts, the economic pressure of the COVID-19 pandemic, and the impact of hosting nearly 800,000 refugees throughout the country. Together, these crises have led to widespread food insecurity, high levels of acute malnutrition, and significant population displacement. Although ongoing fighting and other access restrictions have hindered full needs assessments in Tigray, an estimated 29 million people in Ethiopia are likely to require humanitarian assistance in 2021. With GAC’s support, HelpAge is ensuring access to life-saving health, nutrition, and protection services for elderly, disabled, or house-bound South Sudanese refugees living in Ethiopia’s Gambella region. Project activities include: (1) providing home-based health and nutrition services to elderly, disabled, or vulnerable refugees; (2) providing fresh food rations to nutritionally vulnerable elderly refugees; and (3) providing case-management and other protection services for elderly or vulnerable refugees.

Février 2021 – À la fin de 2020, lorsqu’un conflit a éclaté dans la région du Tigré, l’Éthiopie était déjà confrontée à des besoins humanitaires aigus et persistants, en raison de conflits intercommunautaires sporadiques, mais généralisés, de la sécheresse et des inondations régionales, des essaims de criquets pèlerins, de la pression économique liée à la pandémie de COVID 19 et de l’accueil de près de 800 000 réfugiés dans tout le pays. Toutes ces crises ont entraîné une insécurité alimentaire généralisée, des niveaux élevés de malnutrition aiguë et des déplacements de population importants. Même si les affrontements actuels et les autres restrictions à l’accès empêchent d’évaluer pleinement les besoins au Tigré, on estime qu’en 2021, 29 millions de personnes auront probablement besoin d’une aide humanitaire dans ce pays. Avec le soutien d’AMC, HelpAge assure l’accès à des services de santé, de nutrition et de protection pour les personnes âgées, les handicapés et les réfugiés sud-soudanais confinés vivant dans la région de Gambella en Éthiopie. Les activités de ce projet comprennent : 1) fournir des services de santé et de nutrition à domicile aux réfugiés âgés, handicapés ou vulnérables; 2) fournir des rations de nourriture fraîche aux réfugiés âgés vulnérables sur le plan nutritionnel; 3) fournir des services de gestion de cas et d’autres services de protection aux réfugiés âgés ou vulnérables.

description.narrative: Les résultats escomptés de ce projet comprennent : 1) amélioration de l’état de santé et de la nutrition; 2) réduction de la vulnérabilité des réfugiés âgés ou très vulnérables dans la région de Gambella. Le résultat final escompté est de sauver des vies, d’atténuer les souffrances et de préserver la dignité humaine dans les communautés qui connaissent des crises humanitaires ou qui sont en situation d’insécurité alimentaire.

The expected outcomes for this project include: (1) improved health and nutrition status; and (2) reduced vulnerability amongst elderly or highly vulnerable refugees in Gambella region. The expected ultimate outcome is lives saved, suffering alleviated, and human dignity maintained in countries experiencing humanitarian crises or acute food insecurity.

reporting-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD)

description.narrative: March 2021 - The Grand Sud region of Madagascar faces a severe food security and nutrition crisis. The COVID-19 pandemic has exacerbated the situation by driving up the price of essential products and restricting inter-regional travel negatively impacting livelihoods and reducing overall household income. An estimated 1.14 million people in the Grand Sud region and 203,453 people in the Southeast of the country require humanitarian assistance from January to April 2021. With GAC’s support and other donors, the World Food Programme (WFP) provides additional food assistance to more than 891,000 crisis-affected people until June 2021, the end of the lean season. Project activities include: (1) distributing emergency food assistance through cash-based transfers; (2) treating moderate and acute malnutrition for children under the age of five, including pregnant and lactating women; (3) launching emergency school feeding programs in the country.

Mars 2021 – La région du Grand Sud de Madagascar est aux prises avec une grave crise alimentaire et nutritionnelle. La pandémie de COVID-19 a exacerbé la situation en faisant grimper le prix des produits essentiels et en entraînant l’imposition de restrictions quant aux déplacements interrégionaux, ce qui a eu des répercussions négatives sur les moyens de subsistance et a entraîné une réduction du revenu global des ménages. Environ 1,14 million de personnes dans la région du Grand Sud et 203 453 personnes dans le sud-est du pays ont besoin d’aide humanitaire de janvier à avril 2021. Grâce au soutien d’AMC et des autres donateurs, le Programme alimentaire mondial (PAM) fournit de l’aide alimentaire supplémentaire à plus de 891 000 personnes touchées par la crise jusqu’en juin 2021, soit jusqu’à la fin de la saison creuse. Les activités de ce projet comprennent : 1) fourniture d’une aide alimentaire d’urgence au moyen de transferts en espèces; 2) traitement de la malnutrition modérée et aiguë des enfants de moins de cinq ans, des femmes enceintes et des mères allaitantes; 3) lancement de programmes de cantines scolaires d’urgence dans le pays.

participating-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada

description.narrative: Les résultats escomptés de ce projet comprennent : 1) un meilleur accès à l’aide alimentaire pour les populations touchées par la crise; 2) un meilleur accès à une alimentation complémentaire pour les enfants de moins de 5 ans; 3) des taux d’inscription scolaire et de fréquentation scolaire accrus. Le résultat ultime escompté consiste à sauver des vies, à atténuer les souffrances et à préserver la dignité humaine dans les pays qui connaissent des crises humanitaires ou qui sont dans une situation d’insécurité alimentaire aiguë.

The expected outcomes for this project include: (1) increased access to food assistance for crisis-affected populations; (2) increased access to supplementary feeding for children under the age of five; and (3) increased enrolment and school attendance. The expected ultimate outcome is lives saved, suffering alleviated, and human dignity maintained in countries experiencing humanitarian crises or acute food insecurity.

title.narrative: India Humanitarian Response – International Federation of the Red Cross COVID-19 Appeal
Réponse humanitaire en Inde - Appel de la Fédération Internationale de la Croix-Rouge COVID-19

description.narrative: April 2021 – Coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in India have grown exponentially to over 17 million, with daily cases increasing from around 10,000 at the beginning of February 2021 to more than 350,000 by the end of April. According to the WHO Health Emergency Dashboard, on April 27 alone, India officially recorded over 2,700 deaths due to COVID-19. However, excess deaths attributable to the virus were likely many times this figure. This second wave has overwhelmed health infrastructure across the country. In major cities like Mumbai and Delhi, there are severe shortages of ICU hospital beds, medical oxygen and medications to treat COVID-19. Hospitals are overcrowded and turning away patients. Hospitalization facilities, human resources capacity, bedding availability, and ambulance services are in high demand. A growing number of Indian states have implemented lockdowns. With GAC’s support, the Canadian Red Cross will support the Indian Red Cross in responding to urgent needs brought on by the most recent wave of the pandemic. Project activities include: (1) providing health supplies and equipment to affected medical facilities and communities to bolster the health system’s response; (2) expanding health service provision; and (3) implementing risk communication and hygiene promotion activities within the community.

Avril 2021 – Le nombre de cas de maladie à coronavirus (COVID-19) en Inde a augmenté de façon exponentielle pour atteindre plus de 17 millions; les cas quotidiens sont passés d’environ 10 000 au début de février 2021 à plus de 350 000 à la fin avril. Selon le tableau de bord des urgences sanitaires de l’OMS, pour la seule journée du 27 avril, l’Inde a officiellement enregistré plus de 2 700 décès attribuables à la COVID-19. Toutefois, les décès excédentaires attribuables au virus étaient probablement largement supérieurs à ce chiffre. Cette deuxième vague a submergé les infrastructures de santé dans tout le pays. Dans les grandes villes comme Mumbai et Delhi, on constate une grave pénurie de lits d’hôpital pour les soins intensifs, d’oxygène médical et de médicaments pour traiter la COVID-19. Les hôpitaux sont surchargés et refusent des patients. Les installations hospitalières, les capacités de ressources humaines, la disponibilité des lits et les services d’ambulance sont fortement sollicités. Un nombre croissant d’États indiens ont mis en place des mesures de confinement. Grâce au soutien d’Affaires mondiales Canada (AMC), la Croix-Rouge canadienne aidera la Croix-Rouge indienne à répondre aux besoins urgents engendrés par la vague la plus récente de la pandémie. Les activités de ce projet comprennent : 1) la fourniture de matériel et d’équipement de santé aux installations médicales et aux collectivités touchées afin de renforcer la réponse du système de santé; 2) l’expansion de la prestation de services de santé; 3) la mise en œuvre d’activités de communication des risques et de promotion de l’hygiène au sein de la collectivité.

participating-org.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada

organisation.narrative: Affaires étrangères, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)

description.narrative: Les résultats escomptés de ce projet comprennent : 1) l’amélioration de la prestation des services de santé dans les collectivités touchées; 2) l’amélioration de la communication de l’information sur l’hygiène et la santé dans les collectivités touchées. En définitive, l’objectif est de sauver des vies, d’atténuer la souffrance et de préserver la dignité humaine dans les zones touchées de l’Inde.

The expected outcomes for this project include: (1) improved health service provision to affected communities; and (2) improved communication on hygiene and health within affected communities. The expected ultimate outcome of this project is to save lives, alleviate suffering, and maintain human dignity in the targeted regions of India.

To promote community prevention outreaches, improve access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene and strengthen the capacity of health facilities to respond to and offer treatment of COVID-19 in Kenya, Zambia and South Sudan.

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Supporting the National COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Initiatives

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to contribute to the national COVID-19 preparedness and response endeavours by filling the actual programmatic and financial gaps in the ongoing ventures. For the achievement of the aspired goal, a total of 700 volunteers will be deployed, who will assist in screening, house-to-house detection of cases in collaboration with the Ethiopian Public Health Institute and the Ministry of Health, Risk Communication Community Engagement (RCCE), to reach 5,723,800 people with diverse amenities such as screening, house-to-house detection, sanitization and protection through sanitizing items and protective gears.

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP Ghana - Public Health in Rural Communities of Ghana

description.narrative: Support and build resilience of rural communities in Ghana through provision of information approved by the Ghana Health Service on the COVID-19 pandemic. Support and set-up community-based surveillance systems in rural communities to contribute to early case detection, referral and contact tracing. Purchase and provide the prescribed Personal Protective Equipment (PPEs) to health staff and Red Cross volunteers to facilitate their work.

participating-org.narrative: Ghana Red Cross Society

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP Ghana - Extending Teacher Education for All through Virtual Learning Outreach

description.narrative: Ensure equitable access to the online teacher training courses for up to 4,000 economically disadvantaged student teachers, ensuring continuity of teacher training throughout the COVID 19 crisis. Strengthen the ongoing integration of blended learning into the teacher training programs at the Teacher Training Institutions

participating-org.narrative: Mott MacDonald

description.narrative: 2020 Senegal Covid RRP

participating-org.narrative: Mennonite Economic Development Associates of Canada

title.narrative: 2020 COVID-19 Economic Recovery and Resilience Response Project

description.narrative: Increase testing capacity of health centers, enhance the capacity of Uganda Bureau of Standards, and support the recovery of enterprises from the negative economic effects of COVID-19 and increase their resilience to future shocks through digitization and preparedness planning

participating-org.narrative: Private Sector Foundation Uganda

title.narrative: 2020 COVID-19 Response: Prevention, Recovery and Resilience in Uganda

description.narrative: Provide support to community healthworkers, including provision of mental health services. Prepare secondary school students for exams during lockdown. Support recovery of impacted MSMEs

participating-org.narrative: BRAC Uganda

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Flattening the Curve in Kenya

description.narrative: Support the expansion of laboratory testing for COVID-19 and critical training and equipment for health care workers Nationwide, the front-line of the National COVID- 19 pandemic response

participating-org.narrative: AMREF Health Africa

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Strengthening COVID-19 Response and Resilience Among Women and Girls in Kenya

description.narrative: The project objectives are to: strengthen institutional capacities of state and non-state actors to effectively address GBV during the COVID-19 pandemic and to improve knowledge management of GBV for evidence-based policy development and accountability

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Rights Education and Awareness

title.narrative: 2020 COVID-19 Response in the Slums of Kenya

description.narrative: Precautionary measures like social distancing are not an option for urban slum residents who live shoulder to shoulder in crowded households, and the lack of access to water for washing, healthcare facilities, and accurate information means that containment will be nearly impossible should the virus take hold in the slums. SHOFCO has jumped into action as more support is urgently needed to reach and prevent devastation in Kenya’s informal settlements.

participating-org.narrative: Shining Hope for Communities, Inc.

description.narrative: Building and strengthening the Institutional capacity of the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries, and Cooperatives (MoALFC) to rapidly assess and respond to emerging threats of floods, droughts, locusts, COVID 19 and other emergencies; and also to implement the Agriculture sector Transformation strategy

participating-org.narrative: McKinsey and Company Inc Africa (Proprietary) Limited

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - TVET Skills Delivery and Support During COVID-19 Disruption

description.narrative: To facilitate digital simulation of training curricula and development of e -content to enhance training content access among 10000 male and female youth in Vocational Training

participating-org.narrative: CAP Youth Empowerment Institute

description.narrative: In response to the COVID-19 crisis, provide additional funding to support ongoing digital skills programming for Moringa students

participating-org.narrative: Moringa School Limited

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Strengthening Post-COVID Economic Resilience in Resource-Poor Communities of Senegal

description.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Strengthening Post-COVID Economic Resilience in Resource-Poor Communities of Senegal

participating-org.narrative: Tostan Canada

title.narrative: 2020 Scholars CRRP: Additional Support to University of Gondar Scholars

description.narrative: Additional fundingfor Scholars’ immediate support in response to covid-19 in alignment with the Scholars Program recovery and resilience strategy.

participating-org.narrative: University of Gondar

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Cost Extension to FISFAP Project

description.narrative: To Support 9-month program extension to June 30, 2021. The need for program extension and supplemental funding has been occasioned by the programmatic disruptions due to COVID-19 pandemic and the need for additional time to ground and scale some of the recent innovation and partnerships

participating-org.narrative: Alliance for a Green Revolution in Africa

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP Ghana: COVID-19 Survival, Resilience and Market Access for MSMEs

description.narrative: 2020 CRRP Ghana: COVID-19 Survival, Resilience and Market Access for MSMEs

participating-org.narrative: Invest in Africa

title.narrative: 2020 COVID-19 Response and Online Program Overview

description.narrative: Support in transforming Davis College's programs into e-learning programs and provide financial support to 961 students so they can complete the academic year.

participating-org.narrative: Davis College Ltd

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Improving the Efficiency and Quality of School Inspections at System Level

description.narrative: PEAS will provide public health information on COVID-19 prevention to the community and put in place health/sanitation facilities required for school re-opening

participating-org.narrative: Promoting Equality in African Schools (PEAS)

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Building Resilience for Learning During and After COVID-19

description.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Building Resilience for Learning During and After COVID-19

participating-org.narrative: Litemore Limited

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Supporting MSMEs Recovery, Resilience and Catalyzing Growth During and Post-COVID-19

description.narrative: KEPSA will mobilise its members to access financial support through the Mastercard Foundation funded MSME emergency financial support facility. KEPSA will also develop its digital MSME business hub to provide additional resources to support businesses during the Covid crisis with information on business opportunities, networking and knowledge to enable the businesses to navigate the crisis.

participating-org.narrative: Kenya Private Sector Alliance Limited (KEPSA)

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Leveraging Finance for Growth During COVID-19

description.narrative: To enable the over 3,000 members of the WomenWorks MSME network to access finance through the MSME emergency finance facility to be managed by an independent fund manager

participating-org.narrative: WomenWork

description.narrative: Structure First-Loss Fund to secure over $71 million in 2020 loans ($40 million outstanding) to nearly 900,000 smallholder micro-enterprises (including 245,000 youth-led households).

participating-org.narrative: One Acre Fund

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Micro-Enterprises Strengthened for Pandemic Adaptation and Resilience in Kenya (mSPARK)

description.narrative: Provide targeted digital and financial support to 28,000 micro-enterprises in metro Nairobi and Mombasa/Kilifi areas (Coast) that are Covid 19 hotspots in Kenya, to enable micro-enterprises to navigate and survive through the crisis and reduce the pandemic’s negative impact on their businesses and communities

participating-org.narrative: TechnoServe

description.narrative: KNCCI will act as an aggregator of MSMEs at both grassroot and national levels and funnel this to the proposed MSME fund and facilitate access to suitable finance during COVID-19

participating-org.narrative: Kenya National Chamber of Commerce & Industry

description.narrative: Provide strategic planning, coordination, technical assistance, institutional support and capacity building to the ECOWAS Commission so it can expand and align its full range of health and economic responses to minimize the negative impact of the pandemic on the 15 member states of the Commission, and to position the West African region for rapid recovery and resilience.

participating-org.narrative: Dalberg Middle East Consultancy LLC

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - COVID-19 After Action Review, Build Resilience, and Engage Young Leaders

description.narrative: This partnership will build resilience of most marginalized rural communities in the face of COVID-19. Young volunteer leaders will be distributing PPEs and implementing COVID-19 projects to respond and prepare communities for future crisis.

participating-org.narrative: CorpsAfrica

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to support the Ministry of Health in its national emergency preparedness and response plans by providing timely data on the spread of pandemics, epidemics and other widespread health emergencies in Ethiopia. It will leverage digital technology and data science to provide accessible information to citizens with verifiable, accurate facts on the nature of health emergencies, their prevention and how to obtain assistance if needed. The intervention includes (1) a health informatics data portal, and (2) a rapid response center for information dissemination.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Innovation and Technology - Ethiopia

description.narrative: Build the resilience of 2,000 young women, and 50 young women-led businesses in Benin as they face the COVID-19 pandemic

participating-org.narrative: The Batonga Foundation

title.narrative: 2020 Ghana CRRP - Safety of Markets: An Integrated Hygiene Behaviour Change Campaign

description.narrative: Collaborate closely with local government authorities in municipalities to promote effective and efficient hygiene practices and conditions in marketplaces across covid-19 hotspots in the country. Maintain social and physical distancing in markets, education on good hygiene at all market entry points post covid-19. Undertake hygiene behavior change activities on five core hygiene behaviors critical to COVID-19 prevention for traders in at least 15 selected markets and also target the general public around the markets in 15 municipalities in three selected regions. Work with local governments and national media on pre-empting stigmatization and helping with reintegration of recovered citizens within their jurisdictions.

participating-org.narrative: WaterAid Ghana

description.narrative: This partnership will build the resilience of Inema Art Center, a youth-led Art center that employs over 100 artisans and supports 80 children and youth through art, dance, and music programmes

participating-org.narrative: Inema Arts Center

description.narrative: Providing institutional strengthening to an innovative youth-led university, allowing them to deliver high-quality and inclusive e-learning and support the digitization and resilience of MSMEs in Niger

participating-org.narrative: African Development University

title.narrative: 2020 Ghana CRRP: Catalyst Fund Inclusive Digital Commerce Accelerator

description.narrative: Accelerate inclusive digital commerce companies, to support the growth and resilience of informal MSEs in a post COVID-19 world and create a more inclusive e-commerce ecosystem for all Ghanaians

participating-org.narrative: Bankable Frontier Associates

title.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Youth Think Tank Extension to respond to COVID-19

description.narrative: 2020 CRRP - Youth Think Tank Extension to respond to COVID-19

participating-org.narrative: Restless Development
